Generic Mafia

You look around the table at the twelve other town residents. A crime wave has rocked your small town lately, and all of you were selected to find the guilty party. Unfortunately, the only way to find out who is a crook is by hanging them. So have at it!

Spoiler: "Player List"
Alive
4. mikehart, Mafia Goon, survived!

Dead
11. kiwieagle, Vanilla Townie, lynched D1.
8. Jase, Town Mason, killed N1.
6. Cobblerfone (replaced TheCheshireCat), Vanilla Townie, lynched D2.
5. Empking, Jack of All Trades, killed N2.
1. killerjester (replaced Does Bo Know, who replaced drmyshottyizsik pre-game), Vanilla Townie, killed N2.
13. Robotnick2 (replaced SGRaaize), Vanilla Townie, lynched D3.
7. monk (replaced foilist13), Vanilla Townie, killed N3.
12. Vifam, Mafia Goon, lynched D4.
2. baboon, Mafia Roleblocker, killed N4.
10. wierdalexv (replaced Magister Ludi), Town Doctor, lynched D5.
3. SodaSpirit17 (replaced Heliman), Vanilla Townie, killed N5.
9. YoYoGuy435 (replaced MafiaSSK), Serial Killer, killed N5.


Modkilled
Nobody had better be here!

Game Rules (Borrowed from Nobody Special, from KittyMo, modified from Zorblag, who modified them from Vel-Rahn Koon)

General Gameplay and Etiquette:
1. You may not quote private Moderator-supplied information (either real or fabricated) of any kind. Paraphrasing (for role claims, etc.) is acceptable.
2. There is to be NO personal communication outside of the forum postings unless your role PM specifically allows it. Mafia members may communicate at night and during the confirmation stage in their respective QTs.
3. If you have a role with a Night action your choices are due to me by the posted deadline. If I do not receive your choice via PM by the posted deadline you will forfeit your actions.
4. Roles with Night actions will not be able to submit an action on Night 0 (i.e. during the confirmation stage).
5. Any player with a Night action may instead submit a “No Action” PM to let the Mod know that you do not want to perform your expected action that Night phase.
6. As a general rule you should aim for one post every 48 hours, minimum, to keep the game moving.

Voting, Deadlines, and Player Death:
1. A simple majority of all living members must agree on one person for a lynch to occur prior to deadline.
2. Once you have reached a simple majority no further unvoting will change someone’s fate.
3. Once a player is lynched the game enters twilight until I post a death scene; all players including the one who was lynched may continue to post during twilight.
4. Please submit votes as: Vote: PlayerName. Votes will NOT be counted if they are not bold! Obvious abbreviations or nicknames will be counted so long as they are unambiguous. Vote tags are also permitted if you would like to use those instead.
5. Please submit vote revocations as either Unvote: PlayerName or Unvote. Unvotes are not necessary before changing votes.
6. You may Vote: No Lynch - a simple majority of these vote types are required to send the game to Night phase without a lynch.
7. This game will have 3 week deadlines. At deadline, the player (or No Lynch) with the most votes will be lynched. In the case of a tie, the tie breaker will be the player who has the first active vote on them. Should there be no active votes at deadline no one will be lynched. I may grant deadline extensions if there are a significant number of replacements immediately before the deadline.
8. Once you are killed (either via lynch or night kill) you may no longer post. This means that you do not even get a “Bah” post. The dead in this game are silent.

Miscellaneous/Mechanics:
1. Bold, green text is reserved for the Mod. No invisible/small text is allowed, nor is cryptography.
2. If you have an issue/problem with the game, please PM the Mod privately. Do not post issues/complaints in the game thread.
3. The Mod may make mistakes - please point out any mistakes gently. Mistakes will be corrected where possible, but sometimes mistakes are made that cannot be reversed. These will stand as final to be commiserated over after the game.
4. Please bold all requests to the Mod so that they don’t get missed.
5. Prods of missing players will be issued automatically after 72 hours of no activity or upon request after 48 hours of no activity. A prodded player has 48 hours to respond or risks replacement. A player who has been prodded 3 times is subject to replacement without further notice.
6. Rule violations will be dealt with according to their severity, up to and including a Modkill.
7. If you anticipate being unavailable for more than a 48-hour period please post a notice to that effect in the thread. Treat this game as a commitment. Be considerate – don’t leave us hanging.


The Golden Rule:

Please remember that this is a game and your main objective is to have fun! Be considerate of each other, don’t get personal, and enjoy the game.

Sample PM
Vanilla Townie
You are just a simple villager. You have no other weapon other than your vote, so use it wisely.

You win if all threats to the town are eliminated and at least one town-aligned player is alive.

Writing and sending role PMs now. Game will start when 11/13 players have confirmed to me by replying with the name of their role via PM. Role PMs sent.

12/13 confirmed

Still waiting on MafiaSSK to confirm. Let the game begin! Deadline is August 1 at 6:00 pm EST. (I'll have a pretty vote count/deadline post up later)

With 13 alive it takes 7 to lynch!

Alright, let's go! I like to random vote the first person on the player li-

Soooo how is this a problem, exactly?

The problem is that it if you are town you know you are town. You know every vote on you will be a vote on town. We want to lynch scum.

The object of this game is not to vote town, rather to vote and lynch those players acting in the most-anti town ways, based on our own inner metrics, and hopefully they flip scum.

Asking for votes on yourself is weird, and something I think no player with a town win condition should probably ever do. If the votes pile up to a lynch, you basically allowed scum to hop on for free onto a player who was openly asking for votes, which is anti-town, making it harder to discern who the scum are amongst the townies.

Not only that, but as town you have to show the other townies through your actions that you are town. Asking for votes doesn't have any sembalance of pro-town motive (unless you can explain how voting for yourself and asking others to do so too is actually helping town, and I doubt you can), and I can think of several anti-town motives.

Your actions don't help the town, and as most townies are actively trying to show their towniness and help town and scum are not, I easily conclude you're scum.

Thats why its a problem, and thats why i'm voting you. Actually, more people should as well.

Its because you have demonstrated an anti-town mindset, and that is more likely to come from scum than town.

Your case on me in #33 seems to be solely based on thinking that I actually want to accumulate votes on myself. I don't. Is that the only thing you think I've done that demonstrates an anti-town mindset?
I didn't finish. You haven't exactly explained why bandwagonning out of RVS is bad, so if that's the other reason you think my motivations are anti-town, I can actually argue that with you.

Have you done more antitown things, then, that I have missed? Demonstrating any anti-town intent is more than enough reasons to vote you.

Attitude doesn't define alignment.

Showing people posts does not prove that you're scumhunting. At all. Why didn't you just tell people to read my damn ISO instead of spend all that useless work quoting pretty every post I've made in order?

I was only worried about Ludi's vote because, at the time, it was the only one that wasn't random since it came with an explanation. I'm not going to freak out with every single vote on me. Though, now that I know your vote on me isn't that random, that you think it was gut and followed it up with reposting what I've done and explaining everything wrong, everything up to the four points you give as to why I'm scummy.

1) I'm not constantly joking. That's RVS. I joke during RVS. Since Ludi has seriously questioned my play, I have not joked. Not once. Prove this wrong and I'll lynch myself.

2) If you think this is overreacting to a case, let me show this to you.

Ludi has been concerned with the fact that he thinks I have this desire to lynch myself. Dedicated an entire post to it (which wasn't wrong, btw; read it in context to understand), but then directly links me to it. That's a problem.

Ludi also assumes that wanting votes on myself isn't the reason he's voting me, but that I've done something anti-town instead of simply saying "yes." The only case he's given? The fact that I want votes on myself (which is wrong). He even says it's the only argument he needs.

It doesn't make sense. That's why I'm responding how I am.

3) No. No. No. No. No. Ludi has had a vote on me for a while. I could've voted for him back as soon as he said he thought I was a good place to wagon. He talked more. I didn't like what he said. I voted. I gave reason for the vote. I don't vote for people that simply attack me. I vote for people that attack anyone for wrong reasons this early in the game.

4) You ignored my RVS vote on you. Does that make you scum? I didn't think so. I ignored the RVS votes on me. I'm only taking Ludi and your votes into account.

...hm. Empking also brings up a good point with Jase as a FoS. It's funny how Jase criticizes Raaize for not wanting to discuss, yet Jase hasn't contributed to this discussion once...HM...his vote is on me, too...Jase. Talk. Soon. What do you think of the events that have occurred?

Heliman, you haven't commented on Ludi's or my play. Do you think it's irrelevant compared to what Raaize has done so far? Or did you even think any of it was scummy in the first place?

You looked like:

1) You clearly didn't want to be lynched
2) You didn't want people to think you were too worried
3) You didn't want to be too bold on your vote on Magister precisely because he was FoSing you.

My thoughts on the game
I was a little disappointed in town early on. There wasn't much activity by D2 and D3 so scum seemed to be well on the way to victory. Then came the Vifam-lynch and baboon-NK and I really thought either the town or YoYo was going to win; but then Soda jumped on the almost-confirmed doctor and pushed for his lynch. In the dead QT we pretty much agreed that wierdalexv was confirmed by then as baboon's town-RB claim was obviously false.

I thought the setup was balanced. I was surprised at how far the SK made it before using his BP, so I was glad of that. The roleblocker worked well for scum (blocked the SK and doc successfully) whereas the JOAT, which I consider one of town's more powerful PRs, didn't really get to do a whole lot.

If anybody has any comments/questions/concerns, feel free to let me know. I now respect mods very heavily, especially in theme games; writing creative flavor is apparently impossible for me.
